task_summary: The robot is tasked to swipe a small spherical object using its end-effector across a flat blue surface, following a left-to-right translation motion.

task_long_description.overview: This episode features a robot (likely Sawyer) equipped with a wrist camera, performing a swipe motion on a small ball located on a blue surface. The sequence involves locating the ball, aligning the tool, grasping lightly, moving laterally in the x direction, and releasing the object at the goal position. No visible obstacles are present, and the action is characterized by a smooth motion with minimal force applied.
preconditions: small_ball placed on blue flat surface
stepwise_plan: Close gripper gently to grasp small_ball
Swipe small_ball by moving x axis (rightward)
Open gripper to release small_ball at destination
success_criteria: small_ball is translated along the surface and released at target location
no undesired displacement, drop, or excessive force applied
failure_and_recovery: Object not detected: scan for target up to 3 times
Grasp fails: retry approach and alignment
Ball escapes during swipe: abort and re-detect
task_long_description.termination: Episode terminates when the ball is at the new location and the gripper has retreated from the area.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Returns SUCCESS if the small ball is visible to the wrist camera.
Scans for the small ball in a line pattern, up to three times, each within timing constraints.
Detect the precise pose of the small ball.
Move the gripper above the ball with an offset in z.
Open the gripper to 6cm width for grasp preparation.
Approach and align gripper with ball, maintaining tight position tolerance.
Close the gripper gently around the ball.
Check if the ball is securely held.
Translate the end-effector 20cm along the x-axis to swipe the ball.
Open gripper to release ball after swipe.
Move the gripper back 10cm after releasing the ball.

failure_modes: small_ball not found (visual occlusion or error)
grasp fails (misalignment or too much force)
gripper jams or fails to open
recovery_strategy: Retry scanning for small_ball up to 3 times if not detected
Abort and re-align on ball loss
assumptions: Instruction 'swipe' interpreted as lateral translation of an object, specifically the small ball visible in all frames
No grasp of ball for lift or placement; strictly a swipe motion
No visible target location marks; swipe direction inferred from frame progression
Blue surface assumed flat and unobstructed

expected_success_criteria: small_ball is displaced laterally by 20cm on surface
Robot posture as expected at termination
